text: 350px Portrait of Louis-Auguste Schwiter is an 1826-1830 portrait by Eugène Delacroix of the son of Henri César Auguste Schwiter. It was once owned by Edgar Degas and was acquired in 1918 by the National Gallery, London, which still owns itNational Gallery, NG3286. ==References== category:1820s paintings Schwiter category:19th-century portraits category:Collections of the National Gallery, London category:Paintings by Eugène Delacroix
title: Portrait of Louis-Auguste Schwiter
